title: Child Development with Whole-Brain Approach
headline: This free online parenting course explains how to use the whole-brain approach to children and also handle tantrums.
description: This parenting course explores childhood development to explain the whole-brain approach to children and their behaviour. Raising a child who makes good decisions even in moments of high emotions entails knowing how our brain works. We lay out the basics of horizontal and vertical integration in the brain to let you understand children’s behavioural patterns. We present case studies to help you communicate and connect better with young minds.

courseDescription:
How do you deal with children’s tantrums? This course provides you with straightforward, scientifically based strategies to handle tantrums and build a strong relationship with a child. We explain how to use the basic concepts about the brain in your parenting or childcare role. This approach may not solve all your problems as a parent but we provide useful ways to understand your child and communicate with them more constructively.

The whole-brain perspective will highlight the concept of horizontal and vertical integrations in the brain. What strategies do you use to connect with children? This course presents case studies and parenting stories to focus on connections as you learn more neuroscience and the implications of specific actions. We employ simple language to make learning easy and relevant as you dive into whole-brain parenting strategies.

Finally, we provide easy-to-master basics on how our memories can influence our current behaviour. This practical course helps parents, teachers and caregivers build strong relationships with the children in their care. We explain how to help shape children's brains in your care and give them the best foundation for a happy life as the whole-brain approach encourages the development of healthy ethics. Sign up for this practical parenting and childcare course to learn how to cultivate healthy childhood development.
